benchmark_details.name: MISMATCHED Benchmark for Scientific Natural Language Inference
benchmark_details.overview: The MISMATCHED benchmark introduces a new evaluation framework for scientific natural language inference (NLI) by covering non-computer science domains. It includes human annotated sentence pairs from psychology, engineering, and public health, serving as an out-of-domain test bed.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a challenging benchmark for evaluating the robustness of scientific NLI models across non-CS domains.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Although the MISMATCHED benchmark enhances diversity in scientific NLI, many scientific domains (e.g., Physics, Chemistry) are not covered.

data.source: Annotated research articles from non-CS domains, including psychology, engineering, and public health.

methodology.calculation: Macro F1 calculated based on the performance across all classes in the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Macro F1 indicates better performance in correctly identifying the semantic relationships.
methodology.baseline_results: Best performing SLM baseline (SCIBERT) achieved a Macro F1 of 78.17%.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through human annotations for ensuring quality and consistency.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The datasets include diverse scientific domains but do not cover all possible domains.
